main event: A U.S. Air Force aircraft crew observed multiple unidentified objects approaching in formation while in flight over Topeka, Kansas on August 1, 1965.
interesting points: The crew, including the pilot, co-pilot, and engineer, witnessed the objects on radar and visually confirmed their presence., The objects were observed at an altitude of 12,500 feet., The objects were described as flying at high speeds and in formation., The sighting involved credible witnesses who requested anonymity and no publicity., Further investigation suggested that the observed targets may have been ground targets due to radar anomalies.
witness description: The crew of the aircraft, which included a pilot, co-pilot, and engineer, all reputable individuals.
